trans-unit.source: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure Management Portal, Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore, Microsoft Azure SQL Database, restore database, recover database, Azure Management Portal, Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the <link><linkText>Azure portal</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore is the core disaster recovery protection included for all Basic, Standard, and Premium Azure SQL Databases service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore is the core disaster recovery protection included for all Basic, Standard, and Premium Azure SQL Databases service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Restrictions and Security
trans-unit.target: Restrictions and Security

trans-unit.source: Geo-Restore is enabled for all Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.
trans-unit.target: Geo-Restore is enabled for all Basic, Standard, and Premium service tiers.

trans-unit.source: Back-up retention periods are Basic, 7 days; Standard, 14 days; and Premium, 35 days.
trans-unit.target: Back-up retention periods are Basic, 7 days; Standard, 14 days; and Premium, 35 days.

trans-unit.source: Only the administrator or co-administrator for the subscription can submit a restore request.
trans-unit.target: Only the administrator or co-administrator for the subscription can submit a restore request.

trans-unit.source: The server level principal login will be the owner of the restored database.
trans-unit.target: The server level principal login will be the owner of the restored database.

trans-unit.source: Web and Business Edition service tiers don't support Geo-Restore.
trans-unit.target: Web and Business Edition service tiers don't support Geo-Restore.

trans-unit.source: If you have a Web or Business Edition database you can use database copy to get a transactional-consistent copy of your database, and then export the copied database to a Microsoft Azure storage account.
trans-unit.target: If you have a Web or Business Edition database you can use database copy to get a transactional-consistent copy of your database, and then export the copied database to a Microsoft Azure storage account.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Use Database Copy (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>How to: Use the Import and Export Service in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>How to: Use Database Copy (Azure SQL Database)</linkText><title></title></link> and <link><linkText>How to: Use the Import and Export Service in Azure SQL Database</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Web and Business Editions will be retired September 2015.
trans-unit.target: Web and Business Editions will be retired September 2015.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Web and Business Edition Sunset FAQ</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Web and Business Edition Sunset FAQ</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: How to: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal
trans-unit.target: How to: Recover an Azure SQL database using Geo-Restore in the Azure portal

trans-unit.source: Sign in to the Azure portal using your Microsoft account and select SQL Databases.
trans-unit.target: Sign in to the Azure portal using your Microsoft account and select SQL Databases.

trans-unit.source: In the left navigation, click SQL DATABASES.
trans-unit.target: In the left navigation, click SQL DATABASES.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the page, click SERVERS.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the page, click SERVERS.

trans-unit.source: In the SERVERS list, click the Degraded server.
trans-unit.target: In the SERVERS list, click the Degraded server.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the page, click BACKUPS.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the page, click BACKUPS.

trans-unit.source: Click the database you want to restore.
trans-unit.target: Click the database you want to restore.

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the page in the command bar, click Restore.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the page in the command bar, click Restore.

trans-unit.source: This launches the Specify restore settings dialog box.
trans-unit.target: This launches the Specify restore settings dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Choose the DATABASE NAME and TARGET SERVER you want to restore your database to.
trans-unit.target: Choose the DATABASE NAME and TARGET SERVER you want to restore your database to.

trans-unit.source: By default, a database name is chosen for you, but you can change it if you want.
trans-unit.target: By default, a database name is chosen for you, but you can change it if you want.

trans-unit.source: Click the check mark to submit the restore request.
trans-unit.target: Click the check mark to submit the restore request.

trans-unit.source: A restore may take some time to complete.
trans-unit.target: A restore may take some time to complete.

trans-unit.source: To monitor the status of the restore, click the Status icon at the bottom right of the page in the command bar, and then click DETAILS.
trans-unit.target: To monitor the status of the restore, click the Status icon at the bottom right of the page in the command bar, and then click DETAILS.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
